intro: Cienfuegosia heteroclada, commonly known as the Cuban flame tree, is a species native to Cuba and belongs to the Bignoniaceae family. It is a deciduous tree characterized by its striking orange-red flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has opposite, simple, and ovate leaves that turn yellow in autumn. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds. The botanical features of Cienfuegosia heteroclada make it a notable ornamental tree in tropical and subtropical regions.
